this is a great idea and is something i think should be in minecraft

Why thanks, stevens. In reality, I did think of this Idea for the cave update so that way we have more usage for XP while also acting as special Tools for when you go underground, while also being able to give another reason to why we gotta go to the deep dark. One idea I did have for the bosoms Is that each could be born from a soul using a plus Shaped 3 X 3 grid, which is where we place the materials and a single soul in a bottle in the soul table. These souls could appear In the deep dark as well as other caves (although quite not as common) as semi-rare passive Entities and be used to create the Bosoms. I‚Äôd like to see the idea of Pocket familars be utilized, while Also be balanced to a point where Enderman farms are actually worth It.
This is the most interesting, in-depth suggestion I have ever seen. Add this to Minecraft!!
This is kind of similar to my potion idea that I just made but instead of the player glowing the Ores glow
AbroadKnight, that would also be a cool idea for a potion, but that‚Äôs a little different from what I had in mind, but that would be a cool idea too
They arent adding Dynamic lighting tho
It's called night vision
Maybe there would be an opposite to this that make the player emitt a negative light of some sort

There is darkvision, but I like this because it can be beneficial in other ways: One person in a group drinks it granting limited light for everyone; A player who easily gets lost drinks it so others can more easily find them; Even if not an arrow, a ranged light source could be very useful for exploring. Perhaps the glowstone enhanced version is one that can make zombies and skeletons burn within its radius, making it more useful in caves and where there are lots of trees.
The greener retlins could give poison to unded mobs around them (so they heal them)
A nother thing I don't see them looking like big rats they can be diffrent (have tusks...) just rat/vermine typed mobs.
This is a pretty good idea! Adding mountain biomes would make them much more fun to explore!
Quicklime could be used to make brighter redstone lamps, small controlled explosives in blast mining, and plasters.

The quicklime can be dropped into pools of water and make them boil, dealing 1.5 hearts of damage to anyone entering it. However, after 2 minutes, it will no longer deal damage and the lime will settle out, and can be collected as slaked lime and be used in concrete and plasters. Additionally, dripstone and coral can be smelted into quicklime, not just calcite.
This is an interesting mechanic.
What about rose gold?
Mojang if you have seen this I am not desperate for copper tools in minecraft, it would just be cool if they were
Hi wolf, I think that rose gold is a much better idea than mine

Any item you are currently holding will not be invisible.
I don't think it should make you invisible, but what if it became invisible with you when you did? No other armor does that, so this would add a way to be completely invisible while wearing armor.
But didn't Mojang say that they don't need to be adding more ores?
Good Idea! I agree!
Would also be amazing if they grew up in caves, imagine having gigantic roots falling from the ceiling of the new caves, or natural bridges made of roots on side of some cliffs

That would be incredibly overpowered considering that players aren't supposed to fight them. You'd be able to take on raids and bastion remnants with little effort!
I like this

To me this would fit well with the theory of the Warden Originally being the protector of the ancient city but was corrupted by the sculk.
The potion to cure it should be a potion found in the ancient city or at least the ingredients for it which you splash on the Warden then feed it an enchanted Golden Apple.
Since the Goal is not to kill the Warden this would make sense as a way to deal with it continuing to break the normal gameplay of just killing a mob.
After its cured the Warden should shed of all the skulk revealing a hard dark metal body ( Like and Iron Golem ) and it will stay in the ancient city and fight for you.
They could also make it tame able where it will follow you and you can station it in an area to patrol like in a village I'm not sure if that's to op but it's definitely a cool idea.
Good idea
Do you guys understand ?
It doesn't really make sense in my opinion. Sculk sensors detect motion, not sound.
Both still make noises

Hey, well they said on Minecraft live that the copper ore will have a new type of different looking stone around it to help make a vain, so that's probably why
Copper Ores should start to oxidize when exposed to air

Copper ore needs to be fully green. You do not ever find chunks of pure copper in the earth. Copper ore is made of malachite, which is a green, naturally occurring mineral. Malachite is then smelted down to make copper. You cannot "find" copper in real life. If you are interested, check out my post called "copper ore needs a reskin". Thank you.
This has been in my mind for so long and I thought I was the only one.
